prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC1797 CO(1-0)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: target: NGC1797 line: CO(1-0) rms: 7.1 mJy/beam time: 42 min

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Requested sensitivity: We estimate the expected a source flux of 12CO(J=1-0) from typical mass and size of giant molecular associations, ~3x10^7 Msun,~300 pc (Rand et al 1990, Tosaki et al 2007) Assuming a CO-H2 conversion factor of alphaCO=4.3 Msun(Kkms^-1pc^2)^-1 and a beam size equivalent to a half of GMA, an expected line flux per beam ScodV/beam is 700 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(1-0). A velocity resolution of 5 kms^-1 is needed for possible a line width of 20 kms^-1. Therefore expected peak fluxes are 35 mJy/beam. To achieve 10 sigma, we request sensitivities of 7.1 mJy/beam. Every requested parameters of the target source are summarized in Table 1. Estimated total observation time of this science goal is 48 minutes according to the OT time estimator.
Imaging requirements We request the single-pointing observation for CO(1-0). Spatial resolution to achieve is 0".5 and maximum scale is 15". This observation do not require ACA or TP because the total flux is not necessary to this proposed science. But we request two arrary configuration to cover estimated structures of spiral arms, 15" (a few kpc, Vallée 2005).
Correlator setup We require 12CO(J=1-0) [Band 3] observations. We select the 1875 MHz bandwidth (the 976 kHz spectral resolution) and the dual-polarization operation. The spectra will be smoothed into 1.9 MHz (~ 5 kms^-1). Also we request continuum observations in 3 mm to estimate star formation rate. The continuum emission is considered to be from free-free emissions, which is an indicator of star formation rate.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC1797 CO(3-2)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: target: NGC1797 line: CO(3-2) rms: 19 mJy/beam points: 7 time: 29 min

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Requested sensitivity: We estimate the expected a source flux of 12CO(J=3-2) from typical mass and size of giant molecular associations, ~3x10^7 Msun,~300 pc (Rand et al 1990, Tosaki et al 2007) Assuming a CO-H2 conversion factor of alphaCO=4.3 Msun(Kkms^-1pc^2)^-1 and a beam size equivalent to a half of GMA, an expected line flux per beam ScodV/beam is 700 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(1-0). Adopting A CO(J=3-2) to CO(J=1-0) ratio of 0.3 (Tosaki et al 2007), ScodV/beam is 1900 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(3-2). A velocity resolution of 5 kms^-1 is needed for possible a line width of 20 kms^-1. Therefore expected peak fluxes are 95 mJy/beam. To achieve 10 sigma, we request sensitivities of 9 mJy/beam. Every requested parameters of the target source are summarized in Table 1. Estimated total observation time of this science goal is 32 minutes according to the OT time estimator.
Imaging requirements We request the observation for CO(3-2) with a rectangular field of 31"x31" to cover the region observed in CO(1-0). The number of pointing mosaic is 17 with Nyquist sampling. Spatial resolution to achieve is 0".5 and maximum scale is 12". This observation do not require ACA or TP because the total flux is not necessary to this proposed science. But we request two arrary configuration to cover estimated extent of CO(3-2) gas in large GMA, 5" (~1 kpc, Sliwa et al. 2012).
Correlator setup We require 12CO(J=3-2) [Band 7] observations. We select the 1875 MHz bandwidth (the 976 kHz spectral resolution) and the dual-polarization operation. The spectra will be smoothed into 1.9 MHz (~ 5 kms^-1). Placements of spectral windows follow the OT. Also we request continuum observations in 1 mm to measure the cold dust.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC7679 CO(1-0)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: target: NGC7679 line: CO(1-0) rms: 3.4 time: 50 min

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Requested sensitivity: We estimate the expected a source flux of 12CO(J=1-0) from typical mass and size of giant molecular associations, ~3x10^7 Msun,~300 pc (Rand et al 1990, Tosaki et al 2007) Assuming a CO-H2 conversion factor of alphaCO=4.3 Msun(Kkms^-1pc^2)^-1 and a beam size equivalent to a half of GMA, an expected line flux per beam ScodV/beam is 530 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(1-0). A velocity resolution of 5 kms^-1 is needed for possible a line width of 20 kms^-1. Therefore expected peak fluxes are 26 mJy/beam. To achieve 10 sigma, we request sensitivities of 5.3 mJy/beam. Every requested parameters of the target source are summarized in Table 1. Estimated total observation time of this science goal is 59 minutes according to the OT time estimator.
Imaging requirements We request the single-pointing observation for CO(1-0). Spatial resolution to achieve is 0".5 and maximum scale is 14". This observation do not require ACA or TP because the total flux is not necessary to this proposed science. But we request two arrary configuration to cover estimated structures of spiral arms, 14" (a few kpc, Vallée 2005).
Correlator setup We require 12CO(J=1-0) [Band 3] observations. We select the 1875 MHz bandwidth (the 976 kHz spectral resolution) and the dual-polarization operation. The spectra will be smoothed into 1.9 MHz (~ 5 kms^-1). Also we request continuum observations in 3 mm to estimate star formation rate. The continuum emission is considered to be from free-free emissions, which is an indicator of star formation rate.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: NGC7679 CO(3-2)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: target: NGC7679 line: CO(3-2) rms: 14 mJy/beam points: 17 time: 34 min

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Requested sensitivity: We estimate the expected a source flux of 12CO(J=3-2) from typical mass and size of giant molecular associations, ~3x10^7 Msun,~300 pc (Rand et al 1990, Tosaki et al 2007) Assuming a CO-H2 conversion factor of alphaCO=4.3 Msun(Kkms^-1pc^2)^-1 and a beam size equivalent to a half of GMA, an expected line flux per beam ScodV/beam is 530 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(1-0). Adopting A CO(J=3-2) to CO(J=1-0) ratio of 0.3 (Tosaki et al 2007), ScodV/beam is 1400 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(3-2). A velocity resolution of 5 kms^-1 is needed for possible a line width of 20 kms^-1. Therefore expected peak fluxes are 71 mJy/beam. To achieve 10 sigma, we request sensitivities of 14 mJy/beam. Every requested parameters of the target source are summarized in Table 1. Estimated total observation time of this science goal is 38 minutes according to the OT time estimator.
Imaging requirements We request the observation for CO(3-2) with a rectangular field of 33"x32" to cover the region observed in CO(1-0). The number of pointing mosaic is 17 with Nyquist sampling. Spatial resolution to achieve is 0".5 and maximum scale is 10". This observation do not require ACA or TP because the total flux is not necessary to this proposed science. But we request two arrary configuration to cover estimated extent of CO(3-2) gas in large GMA, 5" (~1 kpc, Sliwa et al. 2012).
Correlator setup We require 12CO(J=3-2) [Band 7] observations. We select the 1875 MHz bandwidth (the 976 kHz spectral resolution) and the dual-polarization operation. The spectra will be smoothed into 1.9 MHz (~ 5 kms^-1). Placements of spectral windows follow the OT. Also we request continuum observations in 1 mm to measure the cold dust.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: ESO557-G002 CO(1-0)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: target: ESO557-G002 line : CO(1-0) rms: 3.4 mJy/beam time: 53 min

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Requested sensitivity: We estimate the expected a source flux of 12CO(J=1-0) from typical mass and size of giant molecular associations, ~3x10^7 Msun,~300 pc (Rand et al 1990, Tosaki et al 2007) Assuming a CO-H2 conversion factor of alphaCO=4.3 Msun(Kkms^-1pc^2)^-1 and a beam size equivalent to a half of GMA, an expected line flux per beam ScodV/beam is 340 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(1-0). A velocity resolution of 5 kms^-1 is needed for possible a line width of 20 kms^-1. Therefore expected peak fluxes are 17 mJy/beam. To achieve 10 sigma, we request sensitivities of 3.4 mJy/beam. Every requested parameters of the target source are summarized in Table 1. Estimated total observation time of this science goal is 1.4 hours according to the OT time estimator.
Imaging requirements We request the single-pointing observation for CO(1-0). Spatial resolution to achieve is 0".5 and maximum scale is 12". This observation do not require ACA or TP because the total flux is not necessary to this proposed science. But we request two arrary configuration to cover estimated structures of spiral arms, 12" (a few kpc, Vallée 2005).
Correlator setup We require 12CO(J=1-0) [Band 3] observations. We select the 1875 MHz bandwidth (the 976 kHz spectral resolution) and the dual-polarization operation. The spectra will be smoothed into 1.9 MHz (~ 5 kms^-1). Also we request continuum observations in 3 mm to estimate star formation rate. The continuum emission is considered to be from free-free emissions, which is an indicator of star formation rate.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: ESO557-G002 CO(3-2)
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: target: ESO557-G002 line: CO(1-0) rms: 9.2 mJy/beam pointing: 17 time: 36 min

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Requested sensitivity: We estimate the expected a source flux of 12CO(J=3-2) from typical mass and size of giant molecular associations, ~3x10^7 Msun,~300 pc (Rand et al 1990, Tosaki et al 2007) Assuming a CO-H2 conversion factor of alphaCO=4.3 Msun(Kkms^-1pc^2)^-1 and a beam size equivalent to a half of GMA, an expected line flux per beam ScodV/beam is 340 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(1-0). Adopting A CO(J=3-2) to CO(J=1-0) ratio of 0.3 (Tosaki et al 2007), ScodV/beam is 920 mJykms^-1/beam for CO(3-2). A velocity resolution of 5 kms^-1 is needed for possible a line width of 20 kms^-1. Therefore expected peak fluxes are 46 mJy/beam. To achieve 10 sigma, we request sensitivities of 9.2 mJy/beam. Every requested parameters of the target source are summarized in Table 1. Estimated total observation time of this science goal is 57 minutes according to the OT time estimator.
Imaging requirements We request the observation for CO(3-2) with a rectangular field of 33"x33" to cover the region observed in CO(1-0). The number of pointing mosaic is 17 with Nyquist sampling. Spatial resolution to achieve is 0".5 and maximum scale is 8". This observation do not require ACA or TP because the total flux is not necessary to this proposed science. But we request two arrary configuration to cover estimated extent of CO(3-2) gas in large GMA, 5" (~1 kpc, Sliwa et al. 2012).
Correlator setup We require 12CO(J=3-2) [Band 7] observations. We select the 1875 MHz bandwidth (the 976 kHz spectral resolution) and the dual-polarization operation. The spectra will be smoothed into 1.9 MHz (~ 5 kms^-1). Placements of spectral windows follow the OT. Also we request continuum observations in 1 mm to measure the cold dust.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
LIRGs have high star formation rate, and almost all LIRGs are involved in galaxy-galaxy interaction in the local universe. Galaxy interaction always distorts the morphology while enhancing its star formation rate. We found a sample of LIRGs which are accompanied by massive galaxies, but are morphologically undisturbed, with its disk structure maintained. These LIRGs are "pre-merger" galaxies, before first contact with its companion, but nevertheless in a starburst phase. The question is where the starburst is triggered in such galaxies, and how much. Two hypotheses are currently given, (A) disc starburst in extended gas due to strong tidal force, and (B) nuclear starburst enduced by gas inflow through a stellar bar formed by strong perturbations from the companion.
Based on these hypotheses, we propose a diagnostics to distinguish the two starburst types using ALMA observations of molecular gas emission lines 12CO(J=1-0) and 12CO(J=3-2) for 3 local LIRGs. We will (1) evaluate the extent of the starburst regions from radial variation of the dense gas fraction CO(3-2)/CO(1-0), and (2) distinguish gravitational influences from a companion using the position-velocity diagram.
